usefulItems: baking dish, baking tray, baking paper, skewer, oven
title: Blueberry and Lemon Spumble

preparations.content: Place blueberries, honey and water in mixing bowl then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>10-15 min/100°C/speed 0.5<b> until slightly thickened. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 170°C and line a baking tray with baking paper. Transfer compote to a baking dish and spread over base then leave to cool. Clean mixing bowl.
Place hazelnuts in mixing bowl and roughly chop <b>2 sec/speed 6<b>.

Add oats, pumpkin seeds, honey, chia seeds (if using) and salt then mix <b>20 sec//speed 2<b>. Tip out onto prepared tray. Bake for 7 minutes (170°C), stir with spatula then bake for a further 8 minutes (170°C). Set aside and leave to cool.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place eggs and sugar in mixing bowl then whisk <b>1 min/speed 4<b>.
Add butter and lemon zest then mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>.

Add flour, milk and salt then mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Pour mixture over blueberry compote in baking dish and spread evenly. Sprinkle over half the cooled granola then bake for 50-60 minutes (180°C) until a skewer inserted in centre of sponge comes out clean (see tip).
Serve warm with cream or ice cream.

hintsAndTricks: What do you get when you cross a sponge with a crumble? A spumble! Two great puddings become one when a blueberry compote and moist lemon sponge are finished with a granola crumble topping. You’ll wonder why you’ve never done it before!
Cover with foil if browning too much in <b>step 6.<b>
Making more granola than you need for the recipe means you have enough to enjoy some for breakfast. Store in an airtight container for up to <b>1 week.<b>
